field.name: description
field.value: Please find attached JQueryGenerator and JQueryElementGenerator implementations with tests for each. This combined some stuff Ayende provided here http://groups.google.com/group/castle-project-users/browse_thread/thread/399e918300a92a27 but with more relaxed selector options.

comment.author: driscoll.davidj
comment.text: This is specific to method: SelectRelevantElements(params string[] ids) JQuery selectors for ids need to have # in front of them. (i.e jQuery("#subject") ) It is properly easier to have JQueryGenerator class append the # to the ids passed in rather than having the user pass # plus the id to JQueryGenerator's SelectRelevantElements method. I noticed this issue when I just grabbed the latest of this file (JQueryGenerator.cs). I just wanted to note this in case someone else wants to submit a patch before I get around to submitting one.

comment.author: csokun
comment.text: don't forget class selectors where it had to begin with "."

comment.author: roelofb
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''Applied''. * '''Version Fixed''' set to ''Future''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Open'' to ''Resolved''.
